definition: Chinese Civil War, also known as War of Liberation 解放戰爭|解放战争[Jie3 fang4 Zhan4 zheng1]

sentences.english: The reason Burundi is so poor is because they have never really had any peaceful time between the everlasting civil wars.
sentences.chinese: 这个国家贫穷的真正原因是因为连绵不绝的内战。

sentences.english: It also reflects the pantheistic experimentation of the period immediately following the Civil War.
sentences.chinese: 同时也反映出了泛神论时期紧跟的内战时期状态。

sentences.english: Staggering tasks confronted the people of the United States , North and South , when the Civil War ended.
sentences.chinese: 内战结束后，美国南北方的人民都面临着艰巨的任务。

sentences.english: It has been 60 years since the country was divided by the civil war.
sentences.chinese: 自从国内战争这个国家一分为二以来，已经60年了。

sentences.english: The Warrior then rebel, raises the civil war.
sentences.chinese: 武士则发动叛乱，引发内战。

sentences.english: During the English Civil War the Channel Isle of Jersey remained loyal to the Crown and gave sanctuary to the King.
sentences.chinese: 在英国内战海峡泽西岛仍忠于官方和庇护了国王。

sentences.english: He was disabled in the civil war; he lost his left arm.
sentences.chinese: 他在内战中失去一条左臂，成了伤残人。

sentences.english: The Civil War began in eighteen sixty-one as a struggle over the right of states to leave the Union.
sentences.chinese: 始于1861年的美国内战是围绕各州的权力而战的。

sentences.english: He ended civil war which began in 193 A.
sentences.chinese: 他结束了193年爆发的内战，建立了塞维鲁王朝。

sentences.english: After the Civil War the great cattle towns were born in the great plains of the American West.
sentences.chinese: 美国内战以后，西部大平原地区兴起了大批牛镇。

sentences.english: The period from the War of Independence to the Civil War is the babyhood of the United States.
sentences.chinese: 从独立战争到内战这个时期是美国的婴儿期。

sentences.english: After the Civil war the carpetbaggers from the north tried to take over the south.
sentences.chinese: 美国内战以后，北方的外来者试图控制南方。

sentences.english: He's born, in fact, twenty years before the American Civil War.
sentences.chinese: 他是在美国内战结束后的二十年出生的。

sentences.english: 1970 – Biafra capitulates, ending the Nigerian civil war.
sentences.chinese: 1970年的今天，比夫拉认输，尼日利亚内战结束。

sentences.english: The Civil War brought a sharp turn to the fortunes of the Bentleys.
sentences.chinese: 内战给本特利一家的命运带来截然的转变。

sentences.english: Mr Taylor recounts one of the pivotal moments in China’s civil war.
sentences.chinese: 泰勒记叙了中国内战中的一个关键时刻。

definition: internal strife/power struggle/(of members of an organization) to fight each other
to start a war/to make war/to battle against
chaotic warfare/confused fighting/melee/to join in such fighting
to contend for hegemony/a power struggle
